title: Ticket #6215: Build fails on Fedora
description: 8.6.1 fails to build from source. Patch incoming (the patch allows the build to succeed, it's not clear if it introduces other problems)
remarks:
2017-Apr-05 11:27:45 by tannenba:
What version of Fedora are you building on? v8.6.1 seems to build here fine on both Fedora 24 and Fedora 25. Perhaps the build broke on the Fedora 26 alpha release?

2017-Apr-05 11:39:19 by tannenba:
Clearly whatever version of Fedora you are using is correct, the code is wrong. But I think your patch is also incorrect, as using the "%.*s" format specifier would require two arguments. I think the correct patch would be 

@@ -418,7 +418,7 @@ GLExecPrivSepHelper::create_process(const char* path,
                if( !retry ) {
                                // return the most recent glexec error output
                        if( error_msg ) {
-                               error_msg->formatstr_cat(glexec_error_msg.Value());
+                               error_msg->formatstr_cat("%s", glexec_error_msg.Value());
                        }
                        return 0;
                }

Could you please verify the above makes your Fedora install happy? If so I will push it. Thanks.

2017-Apr-05 12:36:07 by bcotton:
You are correct, it is Fedora 26. I'll give your patch a try and report back on build status.

2017-Apr-05 15:16:40 by bcotton:
A couple of architectures are still building, but the build completed successfully on x86_64 and i686, so I'm going to say it's good.

2017-Apr-06 10:43:44 by tannenba:
Patch pushed. Thanks for the contribution!

Note: no need for documentation or version history here, F26 is still alpha. Resolving.
attachments:
• glexec_privsep_helper.patch 929 bytes added by bcotton on 2017-Apr-05 13:39:19 UTC.
    Patch to allow Fedora builds (gcc complains about the syntax)
check_ins: 2017-Apr-06 10:39   Check-in [50424]: Fix Fedora 26 build by passing correct num of args to printf. #6215 (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: bcotton
